Questions.Text: Which of the following is NOT a programming language?
What is the time complexity of binary search?
Explain the difference between RAM and ROM in 2-3 sentences.
Questions.CorrectAnswer: RAM is volatile memory used for temporary storage while the computer is running, while ROM is non-volatile memory that retains data even when powered off. RAM is faster and used for active processes, whereas ROM stores firmware and boot instructions.

Questions.Text: Write a detailed explanation of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and its four main principles.
Questions.CorrectAnswer: Object-Oriented Programming is a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects containing data and code. The four main principles are: 1) Encapsulation - bundling data and methods together, 2) Abstraction - hiding complex implementation details, 3) Inheritance - creating new classes from existing ones, 4) Polymorphism - objects taking multiple forms.

Questions.Text: What is the capital of France?
Define recursion and provide one example.
Questions.CorrectAnswer: Recursion is when a function calls itself to solve a problem by breaking it into smaller subproblems. Example: factorial(n) = n * factorial(n-1).
